meanings.definition: A specimen selected to serve as the type of a species when the original type is missing or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The scientist carefully chose the lectotypes to represent the species in the absence of the original type.
meanings.sent2: The museum curator displayed the lectotypes of various species for educational purposes.
meanings.sent3: The lectotypes decided to have a party to celebrate being chosen as the representatives of their species.
meanings.sent4: The lectotypes stood out like shining stars in the scientific world, guiding researchers in their studies.
meanings.sent5: The lecturer used vivid images to explain the concept of lectotypes to the students.

meanings.definition: The specimen designated as the type of a species when the original type designation is found to be invalid.
meanings.sent1: After the error was discovered, they quickly identified the lectotypes to correct the mistake.
meanings.sent2: The researchers reexamined the lectotypes to ensure the accuracy of their findings.
meanings.sent3: The lectotypes threw a surprise party for the other specimens to cheer them up after the designation mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The lectotypes served as beacons of truth in the sea of confusion, guiding scientists back on track.
meanings.sent5: The students created a colorful poster to remember the importance of lectotypes in scientific research.
